bug.short_desc: Spacebar no longer submits/dismisses Javascript dialog boxes

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
In all versions of Firefox prior to Fx4, I was able to dismiss javascript dialogs with the space bar (which would "click" the default/highlighted button). In Firefox 4, this no longer works. The Enter/return key still makes them go away, but spacebar no longer does.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to <http://www.javascripter.net/faq/alert.htm> 2. Click "try it now" 3. Hit the spacebar. Actual Results: The dialog box remains on the screen.
Expected Results: The dialog box should go away, as if I'd clicked the 'OK' button.
The spacebar will dismiss the dialog on Windows and Linux; this is an OS X-only problem.
Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110405 Firefox/4.2a1pre Unable to exit the dialog by pressing the space button.
